name: Not Found
description: The server can’t find the requested resource. Often happens if a URL is wrong or the endpoint doesn’t exist.

name: Internal Server Error
description: Something went wrong on the server side — like an exception or broken code.

name: Bad Request
description: The server couldn't understand the request due to invalid syntax (e.g., missing or malformed JSON).

name: Unauthorized
description: Authentication is required, but not provided or invalid (like missing token).

name: Forbidden
description: You’re not allowed to access this resource, even if authenticated.

name: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing Error
description: The frontend is trying to access a backend hosted on another domain without proper CORS headers. Use `Access-Control-Allow-Origin` on the server.

name: Null Pointer Exception
description: You tried to use a variable that hasn't been assigned a value (null).

name: Firebase Permission Denied
description: Your Firestore rules don’t allow the read/write operation. Update `firestore.rules` accordingly.

name: Address In Use
description: The port you are trying to use is already taken — maybe another instance is running on it.

name: Syntax Error
description: Your code has a typo or incorrect syntax that prevents it from running.

name: Bad Gateway
description: The server (acting as a gateway) received an invalid response from the upstream server.

name: Service Unavailable
description: The server is currently overloaded or under maintenance. Try again later.

name: Gateway Timeout
description: The server didn't get a response in time from the backend service.

name: Firebase Network Error
description: The device has no internet or can't reach Firebase servers. Often occurs during login/signup.

name: Type Error
description: You tried to do an invalid operation on a value (like adding a string and a number).

name: Module Not Found
description: You're trying to import a module that doesn’t exist or isn’t installed.

name: Too Many Redirects
description: Your page is stuck in a redirect loop. This can happen due to wrong routing or server config.

name: Permission Denied
description: The script is trying to read/write a file or folder it doesn't have access to.

name: Constraint Violation
description: A database rule (like UNIQUE or NOT NULL) was violated during insert/update.

name: DNS Not Found
description: The hostname couldn’t be resolved — likely due to a wrong URL or offline server.
